{{infobox character | people=[[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] | name=Nolondil | image= | caption= | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[Númenor]] | affiliation= | language=[[Adûnaic]], [[Sindarin]] and [[Quenya]] | birth={{SA|222}} | birthlocation= | rule= | death=unknown (aged 173+) | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house=[[House of Elros]] | parentage=[[Vardamir]] | siblings=[[Tar-Amandil|Amandil]], [[Vardilmë]] and [[Aulendil (son of Vardamir)|Aulendil]] | spouse= | children=[[Yávien]], [[Oromendil]] and [[Axantur]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Nolondil''' was the third son and youngest child of [[Vardamir|Vardamir Nólimon]], heir to [[Elros|Elros Tar-Minyatur]], first [[King of Númenor]]. His eldest brother took up the [[Sceptre]] as [[Tar-Amandil]]. Nolondil had three children: one daughter, [[Yávien]], and two sons, [[Oromendil]] and [[Axantur]].{{UT|earlier}} ==Etymology== ''Nolondil'' is a [[Quenya]] name. Its meaning is not glossed, but Paul Strack suggests it means "Friend of Knowledge" and might be a compound of ''[[ñólë]]'' ("lore, knowledge") and ''-[[dil|ndil]]'' ("friend, lover, devoted to").{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-556392199.html|articlename=Q.
